int dtc_humantobytes ( const char *  human,
unsigned int *  A,
unsigned int *  B 
)

Convert a human-friendly DTC to the byte representation.

Parameters:
humanthe string code
A,Bput converted data into these
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error

Definition at line 48 of file dtccodes.c.

                                                                          {
    if(!dtc_isvalid(human)) {
        return -1;
    }

    int mod = human[1] - '0';
    if(mod > 3 || mod < 0) {
        return -1;
    }

    unsigned int val; // Will be shifted left for putting in A
    switch(human[0]) {
        case 'P':
            val = mod;
            break;
        case 'C':
            val = mod + 0x04;
            break;
        case 'B':
            val = mod + 0x08;
            break;
        case 'U':
            val = mod + 0x0C;
            break;
        default:
            return -1;
    }

    unsigned int one,two;
    if(2 != sscanf(human+2, "%1X%02X", &one, &two)) {
        return -1;
    }

    *A = one+(val<<4);
    *B = two;

    // printf("%s => %02X %02X\n", human, *A, *B);

    return 0;
}

int dtc_isvalid ( const char *  test)

Check whether this string is a valid error code.

Returns:
1 if this is a valid error code, 0 otherwise

Definition at line 23 of file dtccodes.c.

                                  {
    if(5 != strlen(test)) {
        return 0;
    }

    if(! ('P' == test[0] ||
        'C' == test[0] ||
        'B' == test[0] ||
        'U' == test[0]) ) {
    
        return 0;
    }

    int i;
    for(i=1;i<=4;i++) {
        if((test[i]<'0' || test[i]>'9') &&
            (test[i]<'A' || test[i]>'F')) {

            return 0;
        }
    }

    return 1;
}
